intro: Peperomia pseudodependens, commonly known as the hanging peperomia, is a compact, trailing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped, with a waxy texture and a variety of colors ranging from dark green to reddish hues. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or reddish, emerging from the leaf axils. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Peperomia pseudodependens is popular as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and attractive foliage.
